main event: A sighting of an unidentified object near Blackstone, Virginia occurred on January 25, 1954 at 2315Z by a civilian source. The object was observed as a bright light in the sky which gradually flew to the northwest and appeared smaller and brighter as it flew to the north.
interesting points: The source thought the object was smaller and brighter as it flew to the northwest, and it eventually appeared smaller, bright, and shining.
Conclusions suggested that it was probably a balloon or possibly astronomical in nature.
The report includes details about the weather and wind conditions at the time and place of the sighting, including wind speed, direction, and cloud cover.
A photograph of the unidentified object in the sky was reported, describing it as circular, resembling a bright light, and observed to move in an easterly direction.
The report mentions observations from the chaplain of the 1716th Air Force Band, the chief of the facility at Blackstone, and a civilian source, providing multiple witness testimonies.
sighted object: unidentified bright light in the sky
witnesses: civilian, chaplain, chief of facility at Blackstone
